Computer Science.notes: Admission is to a general first-year stream (Computer Science). A supplementary application is required, and admission is highly competitive, considering academic performance and extracurriculars.

Rotman Commerce.notes: A supplementary application is required, which includes written and video responses. Admission considers academic performance, extracurricular activities, and leadership potential.

Engineering Science.notes: Admission is highly competitive. A mandatory Online Student Profile is required, which includes a video interview and written responses. Strong extracurriculars and a clear interest in the program are expected.

Life Sciences.notes: Admission is to a general Life Sciences stream in first year, with specialization in later years. The competitive average depends on the chosen college within the university.

Social Sciences & Humanities.notes: Five Grade 12 academic courses, including English, are required. Specific prerequisites may apply for certain first-year courses or future program specializations.

Bachelor of Arts.notes: Admission is based on McGill's calculation of your 'Top 5' academic Grade 12 courses, including prerequisites. Popular majors include Psychology, Political Science, and Economics.

Bachelor of Science.notes: Two of Biology 30, Chemistry 30, Math 31, or Physics 30 must be presented. Admission is highly competitive.

Bachelor of Engineering.notes: Admission is to a general first year, with placement into specific engineering disciplines based on first-year performance.

Bachelor of Commerce (Desautels).notes: The admissions committee looks for students who have demonstrated academic excellence and leadership skills.

Bachelor of Arts and Science.notes: A unique, interdisciplinary degree for students interested in both arts and science. Requires prerequisites for both faculties.

Bachelor of Applied Science (Engineering.notes: A personal profile is a required part of the application. Math 31 is not required but is strongly recommended for admission.

group_requirements.description: Two of Biology 30, Chemistry 30, or Physics 30

Bachelor of Science.notes: Admission is competitive and based on a combination of academic standing and a personal profile.

Bachelor of Arts.notes: A personal profile is required. Six academic Grade 12 courses are required for admission calculation.

Bachelor of Commerce (Sauder).notes: Requires a comprehensive application including a personal profile with video and written responses. Math 31 is recommended.

group_requirements.description: One of Biology 30, Chemistry 30, or Physics 30

Bachelor of Kinesiology.notes: A personal profile is required for admission. Anatomy and Physiology 12 (or provincial equivalent) is recommended.

Bachelor of Science in Engineering.notes: Admission is to a common first year. A higher average may be required for early admission offers.

group_requirements.description: Two courses from Biology 30, Chemistry 30, Physics 30, or Computing Science 30

Bachelor of Science (General).notes: One other approved Grade 12 subject is required for the 5-course admission average.

Bachelor of Arts.notes: Requires four other 30-level subjects for admission calculation. A wide variety of majors are available, including popular choices like Psychology, Economics, and Sociology.

Bachelor of Commerce.notes: Three other approved 30-level subjects are used for admission average calculation.

Bachelor of Science in Nursing.notes: One other approved 30-level course required for admission calculation. Admission is highly competitive.

Health Sciences.notes: Admission is extremely competitive. A mandatory supplementary application with written essays is a major component of the admission decision.

Engineering I.notes: A mandatory supplementary application is required. Admission is to a general first year, leading to specialization in year two.

Business I.notes: A supplementary application is required for this program.

Life Sciences Gateway.notes: This is a gateway program for students who wish to specialize in various life science areas in their second year.

Social Sciences I.notes: A gateway program for various majors like Economics, Psychology, and Sociology. Math 30-1 is required for students intending to major in Economics.

Software Engineering.notes: An Admission Information Form (AIF) is required. Admission is extremely competitive, with a strong emphasis on extracurriculars, programming experience, and contest results.

Computer Science.notes: An Admission Information Form (AIF) is required. Strong performance in math and programming contests is highly recommended.

Mechatronics Engineering.notes: An Admission Information Form (AIF) is required. This is a very competitive program.

Mathematics.notes: An Admission Information Form (AIF) is required. Waterloo is renowned for its Mathematics faculty.

Honours Arts and Business.notes: An Admission Information Form (AIF) is required. This program includes co-op opportunities.

Medical Sciences.notes: Physics 30 and Math 31 are recommended. Admission is to a common first year, with progression to specific modules based on academic performance.

Ivey Business School (AEO).notes: Requires a separate application for Advanced Entry Opportunity (AEO) status. Focuses heavily on leadership, extracurriculars, and work experience. Students complete two years in another faculty before entering Ivey.

Engineering.notes: Admission is to a common first year. A separate application for the optional co-op program is available.

Social Science.notes: Includes popular programs like Psychology, Sociology, and Economics. Math 30-1 is required for Economics.

group_requirements.description: One of Chemistry 30, Math 30-1, or Math 30-2

Health Sciences.notes: A very popular and competitive program.

Bachelor of Science in Engineering.notes: Admission is competitive. Possession of the minimum average does not guarantee admission.

Bachelor of Commerce (Haskayne).notes: Admission is competitive. One additional 30-level course is required for the average calculation.

Bachelor of Science - Computer Science.notes: One of Biology 30, Chemistry 30, or Physics 30 is recommended. An additional 30-level course is required for average calculation.

Bachelor of Nursing.notes: One additional approved 30-level course is required. Admission is highly competitive.

Bachelor of Arts - Psychology.notes: One of Biology 30 or Chemistry 30 is required. Two additional 30-level courses are needed for the admission average.

group_requirements.description: One of Math 30-1, Math 30-2, or Math 31

Health Sciences.notes: Program is offered in English and French. The university calculates an admission average based on the top six 30-level courses, including prerequisites.

group_requirements.description: Two of Biology 30, Chemistry 30, Physics 30, or Computing Science 30

Computer Science.notes: The admission average is calculated on the top six 30-level courses, including prerequisites.

Commerce (Telfer).notes: The admission average is calculated based on six 30-level courses, including prerequisites.

Social Sciences.notes: Admission average is calculated based on six 30-level courses. Program prerequisites vary; for example, Economics requires Math 30-1 and Math 31.

group_requirements.description: One of Physics 30 or another approved 30-level course

Biomedical Science.notes: Physics 30 is strongly recommended. Admission is competitive.

Bachelor of Commerce.notes: A mandatory Personal Statement of Experience (PSE) and a supplementary essay are required. Strong academics and demonstrated leadership are key.

Bachelor of Applied Science (Engineering.notes: A supplementary application is required. Admission is to a common first year.

Bachelor of Health Sciences.notes: A supplementary application is required. This is a highly competitive, online-based program with some on-campus components.

Bachelor of Arts (Honours).notes: Five academic courses at the 30-level are required, including English. A supplementary application may be required for some specific plans like Music Theatre.

Bachelor of Computing (Honours).notes: A Personal Statement of Experience (PSE) may be considered. Admission is competitive.
